definitions.definition: The ability to do a task , performance , or execution ; a set of functions that something is able or equipped to perform.
In trademark law, the tendency of a product design to serve a function other than the identification of the product , preventing that design from being protected as a trademark .
The presence of a functional group .

main_definition: ( uncountable ) The ability to do a task , performance , or execution ; a set of functions that something is able or equipped to perform.
secondary_definitions: ( US , law , uncountable ) In trademark law, the tendency of a product design to serve a function other than the identification of the product , preventing that design from being protected as a trademark .
( organic chemistry , countable ) The presence of a functional group .
